chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor
Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor
Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Graciela Sophia Bernal

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Graciela Sophia Bernal in court.  Attorney Rod J Koenen in court for Graciela Sophia Bernal.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for calendar call. Based on defendant's appearance in court, Court cancels stayed bench warrant. Defense received discovery and offer and requested more time for review. Court granted defense's request. All conditions of bail remain. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 36. Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Graciela Sophia Bernal not in court.  Attorney Rod J Koenen in court for Graciela Sophia Bernal.  Prosecuting attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Court issued a bench warrant STAYED until the next court date. Case is adjourned to 9-30-22 at 8:30 am for calendar call in person in Room 310 of the Safety Building.
Calendar call scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Graciela Sophia Bernal in court in person.  Attorney Rod J Koenen in court in person for Graciela Sophia Bernal.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant previously posted $2,300. Court orders $1,000 remain on deposit and the remaining balance be returned to the remitter. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Graciela Sophia Bernal in court with attorney Rod J Koenen.  Gregg Herman along with student intern Josh Rather under the student practice rule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count.
Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on August 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Commissioner Riepenhoff granted Attorney Koenen to adjourn this case form 7/21/2022 at 1:00 to 8/10/2022 at 1:00 p.m.
Corrected Adjourn Letter Request; Filed and forwarded to Judge for review.

Adjustment Number: 22A 066302,
Payable Number: 1019873,
Receipt Number: 22RP028543,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 07/21/2022@1pm
